intro: Cheiridopsis altitecta, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent species is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit and produces small, yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
